intro: Tetracera volubilis subsp. volubilis, commonly known as the climbing tetracera, is a tropical vine native to regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and natural habitats.
